intro: Fridericia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered fridericia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in shrub form, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Fridericia parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
